<jobs>
    <job>
        <title><![CDATA[Printed Literature Quality Inspector]]></title>
        <description><![CDATA[
  
POSITION PURPOSE:
  

  
The Quality Inspector is responsible for product quality, loading, packing, and machine paperwork in the Printed Literature Department.
  

  
POSITION DUTIES:
  

  

  
+  Read and understand production control records
  

  
+  Make quality decisions based on information provided
  

  
+  Recognize the basic functions of all scanning equipment
  

  
+  Load/pack on all finishing equipment
  

  
+  Communicate well with operators and other shifts
  

  
+  Assist operator in preparing machine for production
  

  
+  Assist on other machines while current machines are under repair
  

  
+  Demonstrate positive/professional leadership abilities
  

  
+  Maintain optimum production levels and minimize downtime
  

  
+  Maintain/apply all safety and clearance guidelines
  

  
+ Concentrate on loading machines properly
  

  
+  Read factory ticket at the beginning of each shift
  

  
+  Check quality, pack cases, make cases, check all paperwork, clean area
  

  
+  Keep all work areas clean
  

  

  
MINIMUM EXPERIENCE/SKILLS:
  

  

  
+  High School diploma or equivalent
  

  
+  Ability to read and measure with ruler
  

  
+  Must possess basic math skills
  

  

  
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
  

  

  
+  Must be able to lift, push or pull 50 lbs. maximum
  

  
+  Ability to stand in one place for up to 4 hours at a time
  

  
+      Must be alble to tolerate working in cold and hot temperatures depending on season
  

  
+      Tolerance for paper dust and manufacturing conditions
  

  

  
3C Packaging is newly acquired by Essentra Packaging. Essentra offers a wide range of benefits for all their full-time, regular employees including 401k savings, health, dental, vision, life, disability, mental health and more!  We value our employees and promote from within.  Our core standards for all employees is a good work ethic, great attendance and ambition to do great things!

    <job>
        <title><![CDATA[Maintenance Mechanic]]></title>
        <description><![CDATA[
  
3C Packaging Inc is the leading full-service designer and manufacturer of printed packaging components.  We are growing and need to expand our maintenance staff.  We are looking for experienced, mechanics with expertise in areas such as mechanical, electrical, electronics and PLC.  Must have mechanic experience in a manufacturing environment.  Prior print/packaging experience is a plus.
  

  
This position will perform preventative, reactive and predictive maintenance for all facility and production equipment.  A Mechanic will prioritize work under the direction of the Maintenance Manager and other Supervisors and Managers as needed.
  

  
Primary duties include:
  

  

  
+ Perform routine preventative / predictive maintenance – daily, weekly and monthly regimens
  

  
+ Perform reactive maintenance to effect the repair and put machine into production in a timely manner
  

  
+ Develop and Interact with external resources for specialized maintenance issues / activities (machine work, motor repair, HVAC, electronics etc.)
  

  
+ Use work orders and Maintenance Programs to prioritize repairs or projects
  

  
+ Assist Management with special projects (modifications or development of equipment / processes)
  

  
+ Other tasks / duties as assigned
  

  

  
Qualified Candidates will have the following skills/experience:
  

  

  
+ Mechanical experience with printing / graphic arts equipment – 5+ years’ experience
  

  
+ Pharmaceutical cGMP knowledge -5+ years’ experience
  

  
+ Machine Control
  

  
+ Single and 3 Phase Power, 24-500vac
  

  
+ DC Power 10-200vdc
  

  
+ Proficient in reading schematics, blueprints
  

  
+ Electrical / Electronics
  

  
+ Plant Floor (plumbing, air etc.)
  

  
+ PLC Ladder Logic
  

  
+ Proficient in sensors; Proximity, Limit, Emitter, Receiver, Switches, Amplifiers
  

  
+ Mechanical knowledge of Motors (AC/DC), gearbox, pulley, gear alignment
  

  
+ Computer skills – data collection of time and materials
  

  
+ ability to lift, push or pull up to 50 lbs.
  

  

  
The following skillsets will be viewed as an advantage:
  

  

  
+ HVAC
  

  
+ Plumbing
  

  
+ Pneumatics
  

  
+ Ladder Training
  

  
+ Lift Training (Fork Truck, Man Lift, etc...)
  

  

  
Does this sound like the opportunity perfect for you?  Apply today!  We are an EEO employer who is a proud employer of many of our nations' veterans.  We offer great benefits including free life insurance, telemedicine and EAP to all full-time, regular employees!  We offer paid time off, 401k and very competitive wages.

    <job>
        <title><![CDATA[Recycling Associate]]></title>
        <description><![CDATA[
  
 Job Description 
  

  
Job encompasses all areas in the plant that generates recyclable material as a primary focus. Works closely with other company personnel to meet or exceed customer expectations.
  

  
 Areas of Responsibility 
  

  

  
+ Keep recycled materials in the proper waste streams in order to maximize value
  

  
+ Maintain the balers and baler room and adjacent areas for cleanliness and efficiencies
  

  
+ Operate and maintain the shredder to maximize it’s efficiency
  

  
+ Ensure the compactors have the correct waste stream flowing through them
  

  
+ Maintain the concrete pad adjacent to the compactors for cleanliness as well as the asphalt area around the compactors
  

  
+ Maintain the concrete pad adjacent to door #6 with waste drums and coordinate with the pressroom manager for proper pickups and disposal
  

  
+ Clean trim waste on roof over baler room as necessary
  

  
+ Ensure that trucks containing waste bales are appropriately scheduled to unload and load in a schedule that prevents any overflow
  

  
+ Process bills of lading for exiting waste trailers 
  

  
+ Maintain the forklift in the baler room per the scheduled preventative maintenance
  

  
+ Assist in moving general trash to the compactor as necessary
  

  
+ Must be able to lift up to 50lbs; tasks will require a frequent range of physical activity and motion
  

  

  
Does this sound like the opportunity perfect for you?  Apply today!  We are an EEO employer who is a proud employer of many of our nations' veterans.  We offer great benefits including free life insurance, telemedicine and EAP to all full-time, regular employees!  We offer paid time off, 401k and very competitive wages.

    <job>
        <title><![CDATA[Mini Folder/Gluer Operator]]></title>
        <description><![CDATA[
  
Our team of Mini Folder/Gluer Operators perform setups, maintenance, troubleshooting, and maintain production levels by minimizing downtime for our various vijuk folders in our Printed Literature Department.  
  

  
PRINCIPAL DUTIES:
  

  

  
+ Communicate well with others
  

  
+ Reading and understanding production control records
  

  
+ Make quality decisions based on information and training
  

  
+ Maintain production levels and minimize downtime
  

  
+ Loading and packing product on all machines
  

  
+ Setting up, troubleshooting, maintenance, and running all finishing machines
  

  
+ Design fold styles and machine progression
  

  
+ Setup and troubleshoot all electronic add-ons
  

  
+ Train potential operators
  

  
+ Demonstrate positive/professional leadership abilities
  

  
+ Maintain and apply a
